meanings.definition: To dig out and remove earth or rock from a place.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists excavated the ancient ruins carefully.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers excavated the site to build a new foundation.
meanings.sent3: The dog excavated the backyard looking for buried treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were excavated from the depths of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The excavated soil revealed hidden artifacts from centuries ago.

meanings.definition: To uncover or expose by digging.
meanings.sent1: The detectives excavated the buried evidence in the case.
meanings.sent2: The storm excavated the tree roots, exposing them to the surface.
meanings.sent3: The kids excavated the buried time capsule in the school yard.
meanings.sent4: The truth was excavated after years of lies and deceit.
meanings.sent5: The excavated tunnel led to a secret underground chamber.

meanings.definition: To make a hole or channel by digging.
meanings.sent1: The ants excavated a tunnel in the ground for their colony.
meanings.sent2: The workers excavated a trench to lay down the pipes.
meanings.sent3: The chef excavated a well in the center of the flour for the wet ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The river excavated a deep canyon over thousands of years.
meanings.sent5: The excavated path through the forest made hiking easier.
